pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
there are Ubuntu compiler warnings because `major()` and `minor()` are macros in the GNU C library

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=241)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/warningsResult/
* https://stackoverflow.com/a/22253389/7179595

options:

* `major_number`, `major_component` (not ideal)
* if we want to use `major` and `minor`, perhaps we should `#undef` them in the generated header file?
content.html:
there are Ubuntu compiler warnings because major() and minor() are macros in the GNU C library

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/warningsResult/
  • https://stackoverflow.com/a/22253389/7179595

options:

  • major_number, major_component (not ideal)
  • if we want to use major and minor, perhaps we should #undef them in the generated header file?

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
Do we expect any other libraries to use this function besides `ign-fuel_tools`? If not, I'd suggest we move these conversion functions there, for 2 reasons:

* avoid adding the TinyXML dependency to `ign-msgs`
* The less places we have handling  `model.config`, the easier it should be to eventually deprecate its use
content.html:
Do we expect any other libraries to use this function besides ign-fuel_tools? If not, I'd suggest we move these conversion functions there, for 2 reasons:

  • avoid adding the TinyXML dependency to ign-msgs
  • The less places we have handling model.config, the easier it should be to eventually deprecate its use

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: I initially put this in ign-fuel-tools, and then moved it here for a reason. I'll try to remember why.
content.html: I initially put this in ign-fuel-tools, and then moved it here for a reason. I'll try to remember why.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
I put it here because it matched the design pattern of `ign-msgs`, and requiring a downstream library/program to depend on fuel-tools for conversion of an ignition message seemed odd. A dependency on tinyxml doesn't seem terrible, we use this library in many other places. I'm not sure we are going to deprecate `model.config` yet. I don't have a long-term plan for model.config vs metadata.pbtxt.

How important is moving it to `ign-fuel-tools`?
content.html:
I put it here because it matched the design pattern of ign-msgs, and requiring a downstream library/program to depend on fuel-tools for conversion of an ignition message seemed odd. A dependency on tinyxml doesn't seem terrible, we use this library in many other places. I'm not sure we are going to deprecate model.config yet. I don't have a long-term plan for model.config vs metadata.pbtxt.

How important is moving it to ign-fuel-tools?

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: Thank you for the explanation. I don't feel too strongly about this, and it's true that this package holds conversions for message types related to math. If we think other packages will be needing to perform the conversion then I think it makes sense to have this here.
content.html: Thank you for the explanation. I don't feel too strongly about this, and it's true that this package holds conversions for message types related to math. If we think other packages will be needing to perform the conversion then I think it makes sense to have this here.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: Nitpick: some repeated fields are using plural (`annotations`, `dependencies`, `tags`), while others are using singular (`author`, `compatibility`). Looking through existing messages, it doesn't look like we follow a standard, but it would be nice to be consistent within the same message (and eventually across the entire library).
content.html: Nitpick: some repeated fields are using plural (annotations, dependencies, tags), while others are using singular (author, compatibility). Looking through existing messages, it doesn't look like we follow a standard, but it would be nice to be consistent within the same message (and eventually across the entire library).

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: The style guide recommends [pluralized names for repeated fields](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/style#repeated-fields).
content.html: The style guide recommends pluralized names for repeated fields.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: I think we should document somewhere the differences between `metadata.pbtxt` and `model.config` and what happens during conversion. For example, the fact that only the file with the highest version in `model.config` gets to go into the metadata (which I think may not always be what the user intended).
content.html: I think we should document somewhere the differences between metadata.pbtxt and model.config and what happens during conversion. For example, the fact that only the file with the highest version in model.config gets to go into the metadata (which I think may not always be what the user intended).

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
I've seen `model.config` files like [this one](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src/e6d645674e8a99cb7955ce3b9a1fbe26c58c41f2/simple_arm_gripper/model.config#lines-16) which list dependencies, including their type (model), URI and version. I'm not sure if that's being parsed anywhere or how widespread it is. So:

* We could consider making this field more elaborate than just a URI - which I don't think is necessary since Fuel URIs contain all the info above
* We could convert `<depend>` tags to `Dependency` fields in the function below - maybe ignore type and version and just get the URI?
content.html:
I've seen model.config files like this one which list dependencies, including their type (model), URI and version. I'm not sure if that's being parsed anywhere or how widespread it is. So:

  • We could consider making this field more elaborate than just a URI - which I don't think is necessary since Fuel URIs contain all the info above
  • We could convert <depend> tags to Dependency fields in the function below - maybe ignore type and version and just get the URI?

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: Dependency information is not used right now (in Ignition). I'm ignoring the dependency tags in `model.config` because they are not used, and don't really work (e.g. they use a `model://`). The URI option, when using Fuel, can contain version information. I'm not sure what else to add or change here.
content.html: Dependency information is not used right now (in Ignition). I'm ignoring the dependency tags in model.config because they are not used, and don't really work (e.g. they use a model://). The URI option, when using Fuel, can contain version information. I'm not sure what else to add or change here.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw: Ok sounds good. Maybe we just want to document that the `<depend>` tags will be ignored.
content.html: Ok sounds good. Maybe we just want to document that the <depend> tags will be ignored.

content.raw:
Not sure if we want to make it explicit that this holds semantic versions.

Also, just for [completeness](https://semver.org/#spec-item-9) and future-proofing, we could add (string?) fields for `prerelease` and `build`.
content.html:
Not sure if we want to make it explicit that this holds semantic versions.

Also, just for completeness and future-proofing, we could add (string?) fields for prerelease and build.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
I don't think a message can enforce semantic versioning, which is tied to release processes and ABI/API checking.

Added prerelease and build information:7a3f3f5

I don't think a message can enforce semantic versioning, which is tied to release processes and ABI/API checking.
